item.title: Philippines has tested 2 million for COVID-19 as of August
item.description: The Philippines on Wednesday met its goal to test 2 million Filipinos nationwide for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in August, according to data from the Department of Health (DOH).

item.title: Several homes in Ozamiz City demolished amid pandemic
item.description: Several houses in Purok Sais of Barangay Lam-an, Ozamiz City were demolished by local authorities to give way to a housing project aimed at helping informal settlers.“Paano yung sinasabi ng presidente [na] Stay at home ? Paano yung bahay namin, ginigiba e... Paano kami?”

item.title: 'Sigalot' sa P10-B pondo para sa turismo sa Bayanihan 2 bill, alamin kung paano niresolba sa 'bicam'
item.description: Niratipikahan na ng Senado nitong Huwebes ang panukalang Bayanihan to Recover as One Act o Bayanihan 2, na naglalaan ng P165.5 bilyong pondo sa pagbangon ng bansa sa epekto ng COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: LSIs still camping outside Hatid Tulong center in Taguig
item.description: Several locally stranded individuals (LSIs) continued to camp out outside the Libingan ng mga Bayani in Taguig City on Thursday in the hopes of being accommodated in the government s Hatid Tulong program.

item.title: Philippines files diplomatic protest vs China for confiscating fishing device in Scarborough Shoal
item.description: The Philippine government on Thursday said it filed a diplomatic protest against China for confiscating fish aggregating devices installed by Filipino fishermen in Scarborough Shoal off the country's southwestern waters.

item.title: Bureau of Plant Industry proposes regulation of ornamental plants sale
item.description: The Bureau of Plant Industry has proposed guidelines to regulate the ornamental plant industry to help small business owners as well as to ensure quality for consumers.

item.title: Philippines losing its soul due to killings, say bishops
item.description: The Philippines is slowly losing its soul due to the spate of killings, especially of activists who were wrongfully vilified, the Ecumenical Bishops Forum said Thursday.

item.title: 'Nothing to worry about' - Thailand seeks to ease fears of coronavirus return
item.description: Thailand sought to allay fears of a second wave of coronavirus infections on Thursday, after a woman tested positive having cleared quarantine nearly two months ago on returning from overseas.

item.title: Mental health expert warns of dangers from self-diagnosis
item.description: “In taking the test, okay lang naman, walang problema but in the interpretation, you really have to proceed with caution because when you interpret psychological stress, kailangan doon ng clinical judgment and that is being developed through years of education and experience,” Jeemon Bacaoco, psychologist and learning development head at Mental Health PH, said

item.title: Nurses group calls for fair wage increase, not demotion
item.description: The Filipino Nurses United (FNU) on Thursday called for a fair and just wage increase for all nurses, saying that they do not need a demotion amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.

item.title: 30-anyos na lalaki na may 4 na anak, inakusahang nanghalay sa 17-anyos niyang kainuman
item.description: Kalaboso ang isang 30-anyos na lalaki matapos siyang ireklamo ng panggagaha sa isang 17-anyos na babae na nakasama niya sa isang inuman sa birthday party sa San Fabian, Pangasinan.

item.title: Steve Bannon, architect of Trump s 2016 win, charged with defrauding border wall donors
item.description: Steve Bannon, an architect of President Donald Trump's 2016 election victory, has been charged with fundraising fraud in a campaign to help Trump build his signature wall on the US-Mexico border, the US Justice Department said on Thursday.

item.title: CCTV cameras, speaker system has barangay watching, scolding residents amid quarantine
item.description: “ Pag nakadalawang suway na kami sa CCTV at sa public address namin, di sumusunod, papupuntahan na po namin ng BPSO (Barangay Public Safety Officer) yan para kunin at dalahin dito sa barangay,” a barangay official said.

item.title: Pia Cayetano offended by insinuations that House reps had ill motive for Bayanihan 2
item.description: Senator Pia Cayetano on Thursday took offense to other senators' remarks about the motives of their counterparts in the House of Representatives in pushing for a provision for tourism infrastructure under the Bayanihan to Recover as One bill, or Bayanihan 2.

item.title: 61 OFWs na nagpositibo sa COVID-19 at dinala sa We Heal as One Center sa Nueva Ecija, gumaling na
item.description: Makakapiling na ng 61 overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) ang kani-kanilang pamilya matapos silang gumaling sa COVID-19 at payagan nang makauwi.
